title: Retro Kitchen Tools
description: How well do you remember the gadgets and gizmos that made cooking easier?

questions.question: What popular kitchen appliance, often in pastel colors, had a distinctive tilting head and was made by KitchenAid?
What kitchen gadget, consisting of a handled disc with a wavy wire bottom, was used to mash potatoes?
What revolutionary kitchen container brand, introduced by Earl Tupper in 1946, became famous through home parties?
What type of electric knife became hugely popular as a wedding gift in the 1960s?
What countertop appliance, popularized by Hamilton Beach in the 1920s, was used to mix milkshakes and other drinks?
What cast iron device, often mounted to the edge of a table, was used to grind meat at home?
What brand of heat-resistant glass bakeware, introduced in 1915, became a staple in nearly every American kitchen?
What device, commonly wall-mounted in kitchens, was used to open cans before the pop-top was invented?
What multi-purpose kitchen tool, shaped like a large cone with holes, was used to strain juices from fruits?
What popular 1950s countertop appliance featured a glass carafe on a heated base and brewed coffee using a percolating process?
What brand introduced the first electric blender for home use in 1937, naming it after a bandleader?
What kitchen tool, often bright red, was used to scrape cake batter from a bowl?
What electric countertop appliance, shaped like a waffle, was a popular wedding gift in the 1950s and 1960s?
What Sunbeam appliance, nicknamed after a mix-related activity, was one of the most popular hand mixers of the 1950s?
What colorful ceramic cookware line, introduced by Le Creuset, became prized in kitchens for its enameled cast iron Dutch ovens?
